content:
#### 5. Cancellation
We may cancel this Policy by giving You seven (7) days' notice at Your last-known address and You must return Your original Certificate of Insurance to Us.

You may also cancel this Policy by contacting Us in writing or by phone and returning Your original Certificate of Insurance to Us, the cancellation will take effect from the date We receive the original Certificate of Insurance.

Any refund will be calculated as follows:
(a) **Cancellation by Us**
Premium refund = Premium X the unexpired Period of Insurance (days) รท the Original Period of Insurance (days)
questions: How many days' notice is required for the insurance company to cancel the policy?
What should a policyholder do with their Certificate of Insurance if the insurance company cancels the policy?
Can a policyholder cancel their insurance policy at any time?
What steps must a policyholder take to cancel their insurance policy?
When does the cancellation of a policy take effect if initiated by the policyholder?
How is the refund calculated if the insurance company cancels the policy?
What is the formula used to calculate the premium refund upon cancellation by the insurance company?
What does 'unexpired Period of Insurance' refer to in the refund calculation?
What does 'Original Period of Insurance' mean in the context of the refund calculation?
Is the policyholder required to return the original Certificate of Insurance when they initiate cancellation?
